definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: I don't know what he ever did with the pocket knife I swapped him for it.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白他用戒指換了我的折刀去幹什麼。

sentences.english: Your first big choice in your hun-ting knife pursuit is between a folding or a fixed blade.
sentences.chinese: 第一個遇到的問題是在在折刀和固定柄刀之間的選擇。

sentences.english: The knife mechanism is essential to any folder.
sentences.chinese: 刀具的機械裝置對任何折刀都是必須的。

sentences.english: Arch spat some more tobacco juice on his boot top and whetted the jackknife blade some more.
sentences.chinese: 阿奇又朝靴面上吐了些煙沫，再把大折刀磨了幾下。

sentences.english: He took his pocket knife and in the big oak made a groove.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出隨身攜帶的小折刀在大橡樹上劃了一道溝槽。

sentences.english: All three Rock Creek folders used for this review have several common features.
sentences.chinese: 所有這三把用來檢查的石河折刀都有一些共同的特徵。

sentences.english: He took his pocketknife and in the big oak made a groove.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出他的隨身小折刀，在大橡樹上劃了一道溝槽。

definition: to edge a knife, scissor, sword etc
made of steel/steel (bar, screw, product etc)
